conclusion: Diffraction is the bending of waves around obstacles and openings, more pronounced for longer wavelengths.
Higher frequency light has a shorter wavelength, and lower frequency light has a longer wavelength.
Light beams a and b have different frequencies and are incident perpendicularly onto the flat surface AB.
Refraction causes beams to intersect at point P due to different paths from different frequencies.
Light with a lower frequency (longer wavelength) is more likely to exhibit diffraction.
Light b is more likely to exhibit diffraction than light a if it has a lower frequency.
